result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Received July 8, 2016, Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: March 30, 2016, filed by Court Reporter Christine Grauer, transcript filed in 15CF706

Cases 14CF859, 15CF486, 15CF706, 13CM1530, 14CM77, 14CM686, 13CM1529, and 15CM734 called.  Defendant Chad B Unferth in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole M Masnica.   Leslie Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties address restitution dollar amounts between all the cases.  Victim D. C. makes statements. 
Parties are in agreement and have stipulated to a restitution amount of $94,466.12.  Terms of payment for restitution are as previously set by Judge Foster.  Restitution is as follows: 
13CM1529:  $955.00 to be paid to St. Jeromes Church
14CM686:  $200.00 to be paid to Maureen House
15CF486:  $567.59 to be paid to Guaranty Bank
15CF706:  $2,743.53 to be paid to American Family
15CF706:  $90,000.00 to be paid to Deborah Collins
Calendar call on March 30, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Chad B Unferth in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole M Masnica.   Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests an adjournment to work on a global resolution.  There may be more charges pending from some new referrals.  State believes that, as of this morning, they have all of the information to make a global offer and do not object to an adjournment.  State believes everything could be completed within 2 weeks.  This matter to tag along with 14CF859 for further scheduling.  Court will allow enough time at the next hearing for a change of plea if the global resolution is reached.  Court orders defendant may have 1 free phone call to Teen Challenge to see if he is eligible.  The phone call should last about 32 minutes.  Hearing scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Request for adjournment filed by defendant/defense counsel
Defendant to have no contact with sarah T. or any victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.
